page.title: 14A JAMAICAN SUNDAY
page.content: On Sunday morning I get up at 9.30 and get washed and dressed. I go downstairs and eat my breakfast of akee-a fruit,saltfish and rice.Then a minibus arrives at 10.45 and takes us to our Pentecostal Church.When we get there we meet many of our friends and chat before we go in. Most of the people at my church are black.We sing a lot of gospel hymns and people stand and dance.The Minister stands and we pray and he tells us something from the Bible.The children have to learn about the Bible.The service goes on for three hours.Then we go home in the minibus for a dinner of brown rice,peas,chicken and stuffing.My Dad makes a drink called Ginger Punch from fruit juice and ginger.Friends come after dinner and we speak in patois and play Reggae music.
